qas.question: What contributed to the long standing traditions?
What was governing the polish tribes?
When power needed to be consolidated what was chosen to govern?
What was the governing position limited to?

context: Concerning the early Polish tribes, <a0_0>geography<a0_0/> contributed to long-standing traditions. The Polish tribes were internalized and organized around a unifying religious cult, governed by the <a1_0>wiec<a1_0/>, <a2_0>an assembly of free tribesmen<a2_0/>. Later, when safety required power to be consolidated, <a3_0>an elected prince<a3_0/> was chosen to govern. The election privilege was usually limited to <a4_0>elites<a4_0/>.
